meanings.definition: Stopping or hesitating in speech or action.
meanings.sent1: Her halting speech made it difficult for others to understand her.
meanings.sent2: The halting progress of the project was frustrating for everyone involved.
meanings.sent3: The halting dance moves of the penguin brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The halting flow of traffic resembled a sluggish river on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The halting footsteps of the tired hiker echoed through the quiet forest.

meanings.sent1: The sudden halting of the music surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The train came to a halting stop at the crowded station.
meanings.sent3: The halting of the rain brought relief to the farmers waiting to harvest their crops.
meanings.sent4: The halting of the assembly line caused a delay in production.
meanings.sent5: The halting of the conversation left an awkward silence in the room.
